response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue is that you are modifying the value of the iterator inside the loop. Instead, you should store the value in a separate variable and use that variable in the loop.

For example:
```
Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator();
while(it.hasNext()){
    DataSnapshot dataSnapshot1 = it.next();
    i = i + 1;
    names.add(dataSnapshot1.getValue(String.class));
}
```
This way, you are not modifying the iterator inside the loop and it should work as expected.
